keyMoments.title: Assault on Arlong Park
keyMoments.description: The Straw Hat Pirates launch their assault on Arlong Park, with all active members (Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Usopp) charging into battle against the fish-men to save Nami.
keyMoments.significance: The crew's first major coordinated assault as a team, demonstrating their unity and commitment to saving one of their own. Each member takes on a specific opponent in a multi-front battle.

keyMoments.title: Fighting to Save Their Captain
keyMoments.description: With Luffy drowning, the crew must each win their individual battles against Arlong's officers quickly or their captain will die. This tests their abilities to function independently while working toward a common goal.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew's interdependence and trust. Each member must succeed in their role for the crew to survive as a whole.

keyMoments.title: Defense of Arlong Park
keyMoments.description: The Arlong Pirates face the Straw Hat crew's assault on their headquarters. Most lower-ranking members are defeated by Luffy's Kazaguruma, leaving only Arlong and his three officers (Kuroobi, Hatchan, and Chew) to fight.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the hierarchy within the Arlong Pirates and establishes that only the elite officers can match the Straw Hats in combat.

keyMoments.title: Arlong's Tactical Trap
keyMoments.description: Under Arlong's leadership, the fish-men exploit Luffy's vulnerability by throwing him into the pool, creating a psychological and tactical advantage by forcing the Straw Hats to fight while their captain drowns.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Arlong's cruel intelligence and tactical thinking as a captain, using his crew's natural advantages (fish-men in water) to maximum effect.
